intro: Physostemon medicagineus, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation areas.
